00Y4OjkoK50aDFVIDmVzuQ.text: This place is great, it's a darn shame there's only one of them in London. The restaurant has a nice vibe and comfortable. Everything was nice and clean in a great location to Spitafields Market.DF/Mexico's food is great and they have a menu full of variety. I was tempted to choose the burger but I couldn't bring myself to do it... this time - maybe next.Amigos this American Southerner in London loves some good Mexican food and this place is worth a try so stop on by, y'all.

gaSajGiDyC7oR18fqV-4fQ.text: A new Mexican place near Bricklane. It is definitely a welcome addition to all the curry places. It is the sister restaurant Wahaca. The restaurant is quite casual, featuring communal tables and a self-serving ordering system. Upon arrive of the restaurant, you are led to a table that is marked. You then can go to the front and order your food on the two touch screens. You will get your drinks immediately and food will be brought to your table as it is ready. The whole process is very efficient and smooth and you no longer need to get the attention of your server to order or pay. I really like it. The menu features burritos, tacos and tortas and your variation includes chicken, beef, pork and seafood. The pricing is very reasonable. I ordered grilled stake burrito for lunch. The taste was decent, but the meat was under seasoned. What I do like is the all you can drink agua fresca. There are three flavors, and the lime and chia is very tasty. It is a good place to come for a quick lunch, but will not be my first choice for dinner.

enudpWjLPPKMD3CkPzHyAg.text: My husband took me to this new spot in Brick Lane because we love Mexican food, and well I'm Mexican! I miss my moms cooking so I always need my fix of burritos and tacos. While I looked at the menu of course I had to order some tacos we ordered the pulled pork tacos and the chicken tacos, and a torta. The torta is not the traditional torta I have back home, but a brioche bun with slaw and pulled pork. It was all really delicious. The chicken tacos were not to my liking, I wasn't a fan of the pumpkin sauce I love spicy!! Everything else was really tasty. Like I said not traditional Mexican but very good food, and very tasty. Next time I will try the burrito! :)

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Pulled pork torta with slaw and chilli fries. Yummy

V0NCbo8cxpGIaBzgFRq-7w.text: Very nice food! Delicioso guacamole, great service at good price, top up drinks free.

Z2Y0WQzVIBUEci3mza6vdQ.text: Not a very big fan of this place. Yes, the design is quite nice but the food isn't anything special. My tacos were full of iceberg lettuce - nothing to do with Mexican food at all. I missed those special spices, the crema, the long-braised meat... This was just very bad.

ob3sMEW-r-nC5UOBsDSlvw.text: A step up from Thomasina's Wahaca chain, dishes and ingredients are fresher and aim to recreate a big-city café, a fusion between DF and NYC-style dining but with the always delicious Mexican flavor profiles. Abby got the make-your-own taco, I got the house pork burrito. Abby's dish was a little more interesting and flavorful but my burrito was so so satisfying, especially doused in the optional "DF Hot Sauce"--habanero with a hint of honey. The bottomless, self-serve soft drinks is a great, great feature that more London eateries should come around to. I loved the horchata but wished some cinnamon had been available in addition to the cinnamon already infused. All in all, a delightful meal. We will be back.

cxJ_uOvPngkSsPRTommdCA.text: I visited twice in one week, I love this place!It's set up similar to how you would order at Nando's with you heading up to the tils to place your order and collect the various chilli sauces available.The menu is split into burritos, torta, tacos and sides. The veggie nachos are fantastic covered with cheese and a great tasting guac. The chicken tacos are a great flavour and the "chilli fires" (veggie friendly) are just the right amount of fiery.This place is also excellent value for money with a main, side and a drink coming under £15!

IGzB1U6TK-w6rDw6TtX_tw.text: My husband, 9 year old daughter and I went for lunch on Saturday. I found their beer list a bit small (and they were out of one of the selections) but the 3 Aguas Frescas were lovely. My husband and I each had fish tacos; they were tasty and had a nice crunch on the fish. My daughter found her chicken tacos a bit too spicy, but really enjoyed her corn with cheese topping. She also loved the vegetarian nachos. I wish the order taker had discussed with us the amount of spice on my daughter's menu choice - it would've been nice if the person had offered to leave off the spicy sauce or at least mentioned it. Of course I should have asked myself - will be sure to do that next time.

NRTv14WdElzGm89FHvoSaA.text: Funky Mexican, tasty tasty! Great selection and local beers. Nachos with slow cooked beef and awesome soft she'll tacos. Sweet!

Gi_xLunFtQzhSaL7To1ViQ.text: Solid authentic Mexican in the heart of London. I didn't think it was possible. But this place is the real deal.

opM8INgm6Z6uElE58g-k3w.text: Just OK. Kind of annoying having to sit down then get up and order, prefer it with either just no wait staff or proper sit down service. Food wise very beautifully presented, but taste somewhat lacking, just not as flavorful as I was hoping. Their various flavored soft drinks are fantastic though and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

YLydND3iqfJhCQWoKdxykg.text: Very nice place, not too crowded, not expensive.Kind staff, fast service and really delicious burritos!Ps. Must try the fresh endless drinks!

JJD1ZCeYS57BahMNAvjcwA.text: Great atmosphere and very reasonably priced menu. It has all the common mexican affair from tacos to burritos. It is not very authentic mexican restaurant but felt as if it was Californian mexican restaurant. Order at the till and sit down makes the ordering a bit easy and less hassle to leave. Soft drinks are all free refills - fun place. Definitely recommend it.

Qo_BPJ3K30wzYZuAAHBNmQ.text: The first time I went here they had run out of the vegetarian filling, so I just had tacos. I'm not sure how you run out of vegetables!The next time they did have the veggie option. The food here is very fresh and tasty. Bottomless drinks are good.

tq7jTHOXqieAcsRWknknug.text: I had the chicken burrito which was alright except for the chicken. Instead of only using chicken breast they used other parts, too, which I found slightly gross. Other comparable places like breakfast club or tortilla only utilise tender chicken breast. There was skin, gooey bits and a small bone in my burrito :( I definitely will not have anything with chicken or meat in this place ever again! The bottomless drinks were nice, especially tasty the horchata and lime lemonade. The chips were average and the slaw salad quite bland. Would recommend this place to thirsty vegetarians.

2XR36uXkW8eVkKjv85LoSQ.text: Today's one-word restaurant review, brought to you by the fine folks at DF Mexico:No.Digging a tad deeper, I was hoping for something akin to a typical West Coast-style taqueria.  Instead, I got something closer to Nando's.  Including the ridiculous "sit down, then stand up and order, then sit back down" nonsense (seriously, folks -- once I sit down, the last thing I want to do is stand back up again and walk to the damn counter), to the bottomless soft drinks and to the carry-your-own-sauces-to-the-table thing (though they only had one sauce available, which wasn't nearly hot enough nor tasty enough). My burrito was bland and needed a greater meat-to-everything-else ratio. Nice try.  Please try again.

RarPSyFTXv9NrFcd2psbZA.text: So incredible... Wish I lived in London and could come back!!My boyfriend and I found this place on Yelp and loved it so much we went back with his family the next night. The fish tacos, chille fries and the bottomless drinks were just incredible. My favorite drink was the hibiscus one. Must eat here!!!

c2DHQBr0Srdz2bTLMCv7YA.text: Great mexican food! Stumbled across this place whilst shopping at the vintage markets around Spitafields. The food is fresh & tastes authentic. The seating is a mixture of booths and tables. Staff is friendly and attentive. You get seated and then you order your own food at the counter & staff will bring it to your table. They have tablets you can order from or a person at the till. If you opt for a bottomless drink- you can get yourself free refills in the center of the floor. I had the lime & chia aqua fresca and it was lovely. I then had the roasted vegetable burrito. It was good and had a lot of flavour in it. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was that they had some courgette in the burrito. Courgette's don't belong in mexican food. However- the flavour of the rest of the burrito was very good. I got the "bad boy" size which comes with a few chips and guacamole. If you add a side it's cheaper then if you buy one stand alone. I got the chili fries which were a good size portion. I then also shared a side of the DF slaw & cup of corn with my friend. Both sides had a lot of flavour. I liked the cheese crumbled in the corn. I also really liked the selection of hot sauces- especially the Valentina sauce.  All in all- a very filling meal at a good price with friendly service. We will return.

HmsaLTUX1H0NGvooyl42cg.text: One of the least tightly rolled burritos I've had the pleasure of experiencing... there's potential, just not yet reached.

IniUeqwJ8psqM5aDYHPSTw.text: Amazing ambience. The food is delicious... Mexican food for a reasonable price. We tried the chicken burrito and pork burrito (both were awesome). The beers were tiny but the unlimited horchata and lemonade were perfect. After waiting for 25 minutes for food, we complained and received free desserts. The passion fruit and coconut with soft with ice cream was a tropical twist. Great place to meet with friends - the open, sunny setting was pretty and welcoming.

iZJDKX4_WCq-KHPHWnhq9Q.text: I've been there twice, mainly because I wanted a place to sit down instead of eating at one of the many street markets around Brick Lane. To be honest, the Frozen Margarita might have also played a big part in my decision to return - I'm absolutely in love with them. (Don't get the idea to bite into the lime after finishing the glass. I was stupid enough to try.) On my first visit I had the Fish Tacos, which are MSC certified, so you can enjoy your fried fish knowing that you're not harming the seas too much. The second time I had the Avocado Salad and although I first feared that it wouldn't fill me up, the bowl turned out to contain more yummy things than it seemed at first.Although it's self-service and you enter your order and pay on a computer at the bar, the staff is friendly and always ready to help out.

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. The irresistible Frozen Margarita

xmH4uJqaDHRcFSipV3Cwsg.text: I hate leaving bad reviews but I am a real stickler for good service- which I did not see evidence of here. Don't get me wrong, the food is nice, nothing amazing. There's no salsa, the guacamole can't decide if it's half an avocado or liquid (with not much in between those two states), but flavours were  interesting and the chipotle mayo and ketchup were good.I came for a friends birthday, a large group of us. After we figured out the way the menu works (pick your choice, order at the counter) we got our orders in and waited. The frozen margaritas were nice, as was the bottomless softs drinks. I liked the self serve element of that.Birthday girl ordered a bunch of stuff for the table along with her food, and then we all individually. I ordered last, but my food came within 15 minutes, along with everyone else's but one others, shortly after.My friend had to go and enquire after her order, as only two of the three shared dishes came. There was a wait and then it appeared. 30 minutes later (45 minutes after ordering, and we'd all pretty much finished by then) she had to go up again and enquire after her meal and the other missing meal. The man working the pass to take the food out was very casual about it, with no apology for the wait, and after another 10 minutes or so, both had their meals. The server was not apologetic and couldn't understand that we were not happy. No apologies, no exposition. Just 'let me see you receipts', 'I'll go and check' and similar. She said that it was her birthday and perhaps he could make a gesture of something nice for the table, like some margeritas for us, and he said no, he can only do one, and then he disappeared. (Fyi the margeritas are made en mass and served from a soft ice cream machine. Easy to dispense. We had all ordered mains and drinks so had all spent at least £15-20 each, so we weren't piss takers)He came back, put a margerita next to her and walked off, and kind of shouted 'happy birthday' over his shoulder when he was about 5 steps away, and still walking. The conversation was then pretty much about what a rude guy he was, and how the food wasn't authentic, that we would never come back. (I wasn't coming back anyway, but you know, nail in the coffin and all that).So... Come if you don't care about service and aren't fussed about authenticity. It's in a good location so that's appealing I suppose.

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Chilli fries, fish taco (which was more deep fried bread than fish tbh), various sauces and frozen margarita.

ppqMCkS8b-cNBmTw4WZ0rg.text: I would rate this place as very average and with a bizarre mix of food on the menu. The chili beef tacos are tasty, but don't waste time with the fries.

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Chili fries- not what I expected.
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Chili beef tacos
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Veggie burrito

EMZSyN3J0U2Iy4GcDmn5kA.text: Really good food. You need to order the food at the bar via a self service machine and the food is delivered to your table. The food prep time was speedy and tasted fresh. My favorite were the selection of sauces and free refills on homemade juices

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom

QlnVizpTAn7Js6WlkbWyyA.text: Right, Mexican food is an obsession and it was here that my obsession was totally fulfilled.The food is unreal and if you're in the capital looking for that vibe, this is well worth the trip.The surroundings are initially very cool, and it's smack bang in the middle of "trendy" brick lane and Truman Brewery. A really cool vibe with more than friendly staff. The menu is vast and plenty of options. Burritos, tacos are obvious but they've got some excellent options and burgers if you fancy something else.Kicking things off with some traditional Mexican beers and Guack, it was obvious we were on to something. The dip was perfect and certainly made fresh for that night. As there was two of us we spilt some fish tacos and a pork burrito, a pretty good idea to try as much of the menu as you can. The burrito was stuffed to the bring and the flavours were amazing. Good sense of coriander running throughout, which for me is key in this type of cuisine. The fish tacos were just as good and unlike other places, a really good portion. Two huge battered fish fillets lay on top of shredded salad and spices. I could of easily powered through 10. They've got a really nice selection of sauces and condiments to accompany the meal too. We delved into the hot sauce "valentinas" I think and the habenro mix. Both great of the huge side of chips they provide. To nail the whole meal we also added a side of slaw, a perfect mix or red cabbage with a slight kick from chilli flakes, not too creamy too which I hate coleslaw to be!We both were in awe before, during and after the meal. The food disappeared off the plate and we did even mull over an extra order of tacos. Seen a few reviews slating the ordering system (you order at the counter) I think it works well, seems quicker and gets you up to discover the fresh drinks on ice and condiments they have to offer. Plus you get your beer quicker. Also just as a note, we rolled in here about 8pm on a Friday and walked into a table. Given where it is and how busy the area is we thought we'd be up against a long Q or wait. Pleasantly surprised. Obviously another reason to go!The makers of Wahaca are on to an absolute gem here and arguably my favourite Mexican spot in the capital. Plans are already set to get back here this weekend and I suggest you do the same...TACOS!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Amazing hot sauce on offer...
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. The spread of champions. Look at the fish on them tacos!!

RN7M87DaQSZpFUw1eUY8dg.text: This place is really special because it's not just the regular "tex-mex" type Mexican food; instead it serves really interesting flavours with an authentic base. Being from Los Angeles and studying in the UK for a year really made me miss having an abundance of this cuisine. This was actually my last meal in London before heading back to the States and I am so pleased I decided to try here. Whenever I eat Mexican food I always want a burrito. I thought my steak burrito was excellent, the meat was cooked to a nice medium-medium rare although the meat to rice ratio was a bit off. Again, there were some very interesting flavours going on that I would never thought would be good but surprisingly elevated the burrito to a whole new level. I just wish I had a bigger portion of corn chips on the side. I got a huge heap of guac which was nice but not too many chips to dip into it. We also tried the DIY Mexican boards which come with soft tortillas, slaw, corn chips, the unique chipotle hibiscus salsa, guac and you get to choose the meat. This is the best menu option for those who are hungry! Our meals were the star, but I think the drinks deserve some credit too. The hibiscus agua fresca is incredibly refreshing. I also tried the lime and chia, which was good, and the horchata which was perfect! I make horchata for myself every so often and theirs is spot on. Would definitely recommend trying at least one of these out, they are bottom-less after all!Staff are super friendly, great vibe, cool set-up and design. Highly HIGHLY recommend this place if you're in the mood for Mexican.

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Steak burrito
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. DIY Mexican Board (steak & cheese 'alambres')
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Hibiscus Aqua Fresca "juicy water" + Fanta (lol)

gsHS-72WzMBDzV6u8mSkQA.text: pretty decent mexican restaurant for london's standard. it's almost like a diner ish/ fast food place that serves easy mexican food (plus chips of course)bottomless horchatas and hisbiscous drink are a plus (not bad on that horchata). veggie nacho was a bit of a let down... chips were tad cold (stingy portion) and it just wasn't cheesy beany/ sour creamy enough.. nope my sombrero hasn't fallen off. but hell yall GET the Mexican board!!!! the mushroom board was delicious and comes with a stingy side of cabbage and a microsopic size of guac just enough to dip your toes on. (though £10 for mushrooms is tit steep guys.. £10 gets you a whole farm of mushrooms in Mexico, just sayin') oh the fish taco was also equally delicious and not over fried. topped with mayo. dapper standards. they've definitely done their research on this urban outfitters-esque tex mex restaurant. they also serve tortas aka burgers and chili chips. good for groups and takeaways. get drunk on frozen margsssssss!

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. veggie nachos

VkX60o0xU9csuUfOEUB0wQ.text: The place is just right for the location on the side of the Truman Brewery right off Brick Lane and they've made good use of the industrial space with a decor to match.They show you to a table (or seats at the window bar in our case) and give you a table number. After deciding what you want on the menu you go up to the counter and place the order yourself on the touchscreen and pay directly by card. I do like this. It's efficient, less risk of incorrect order and no waiting around for someone to come over to your table. Just go, tap it in and done, and paid for too. Seems to me this is a way to go for more place in the future.The menu is well designed and has some appealing sounding options. Casual, no nonsense Mexican themed stuff.Food came pretty quickly since it seems to be designed to be production line friendly. I got the carne con chili DIY Mexican board which turns out to be some soft tortillas (home made and good but would prefer if they increase the count by one more), a mini pan of succulent beef chili and beans which was well made with good depth of flavour, topped with cheese and some sour cream. A small side of red cabbage slaw which complemented the beef well and a few tortilla chips and guacamole. The tortilla chips were freshly made and the guac was also good and chunky and fresh tasting. Chipotle salsa was nice and smoky / spicy. My dining partner's choice of chili rub steak with fries was reported to be not as good. Steak was average and the 'fries' were exactly the kind that what would be called 'chips' at a Motorway Service station on the M1, straight from the industrial freezer bag except you would get more of them on the M1. The tiny stack of completely wilted unidentified green leaves on the side didn't help either.So slightly mixed but overall a good experience from my side and came to just over £20 (drinks excluded) plus when we had finished there was no waiting to try and get the bill, we just upped and went. A good addition to the growing London Mexican food scene.

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Carne con chile board

bHJunhf6SywAdZLmvEPnBA.text: When I first read about this place "fast food version of Wahaca" I was quite excited to see what it was all about. The first time we ate there I left really happy and excited about it but having been there a few times now my feelings have waned. (Much like a deceivingly good first date the first impressions were great but once the shine wears off you're disappointed!) It isn't that there's anything bad about it per se so much as there isn't anything that great? The food is reasonably priced and is just typical wahaca fare. We've had the burritos, the tacos, the nachos and all of the sides. The sweetcorn I was originally in love with as anything with feta is good in my book but it really is a russian roulette as to whether you get cheesy goodness or a watery mess that looks less than appealing. The only thing I can say that I love here is the hibiscus water and the desserts. Everything else is just okay. However, it is nice to have a place that serves burritos which is quite spacious.The general decor and layout of the restaurant is really nice. Alright on the whole but nothing to write home about.

S22rYy7JfBPx8wpoW-ztBA.text: I came here a few weeks ago and enjoyed my experience. The place is set up like many places now where you order and pay at a separate till. The service was extremely quick, and the quality of the food seemed very high. They also had a strange selection of drinks which was really interesting. We had some nachos to start, and the guacamole was exceptional. I then had a pull-pork-type burger with some spicy chips. The chips were a little too spicy for me, but not uncomfortable, it just took some of the other flavours away. While the food was good, I thought the price was pretty average. I would go again, but I wouldn't race back to try their food. I'd probably choose a Wahaca instead.

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom

Fs-FDwzc9qINaX5o7M522g.text: They had me at their all-you-can-drink idea; you have the choice between the hibiscus ice tea, the limeonade or the horchata (rice milk with cinnamon) that you can refill as much as you want for like 2,95£! We both took a chicken burrito and nachos with guacamole.  OH MY! So spicy but so good! And quickly served,  what else do you need? Perhaps more horchata! Def returning next time I'm in London!!

LPYH-maC9MzHG2JjzRwZjQ.text: We had grilled chicken tacos and pork tacos with a little bowl of cabbage slaw. Friendly and quick service, in a large clean space. The bathrooms are particularly nice, unexpectedly for a fast-casual joint. The tacos are folded into thick little flour tortillas, they pack a lot of flavor and fat into a small package. They offer intensity rather than quantity, and left me satisfied. The slaw, which is deep pink and flavored with apples, lime, and salt, was a standout.

sqBy5cL6JrPJcBsoRumoeA.text: I was rather disappointed.  Granted it was pretty dead on a Monday so there was little vibe to pick up on but I've had decent food at Wahaca so thought this would match.  I wasn't so thrilled with the idea of being seated, looking at a menu and then going to the counter and needing to remember our table number.  So I had to lug my laptop bag through the restaurant to place our order and hope that everything else was safe.  I really like the fish tacos at Wahaca so I opted for them at DF.  They were dry and tasteless.  This is a panko batter but the beer batter (and for that matter the slaw) are much better at Wahaca.  Food was less than good and the atmosphere was lacking and I just couldn't get behind the concept.  Ended up just washing my meal down with a lot of bottomless cups of horchata.  Meh...

r2ZAFJl_RrJ0uFNcyseWlQ.text: Great spot! Super hip here in shore ditch London! I got the chicken burrito combo with a side of fries. Very tasty! But nothing compares to a westcoast Mexican burrito. So my rating is based on my experience eating authentic burritos. I'm a burrito snob lol. Staff were extremely friendly! Very beautiful restaurant. I'll be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. House chicken burrito combo. Yummy!

rFGEXwt46yuN83jsKIOlIA.text: We passed this restaurant accidentally, while looking for a place to eat. When we were seated, there was a keychain they attached to our table (I still don't know why). You have to order at the till from a human or a computer. I ordered the fish 'burger' with rice via the computer (there were 4 people before me for human ordering, with their permission I cut the line). I was a bit disappointed about the size of the burger, but the rice and burgers were enough for me to not be hungry. What I also really liked was that the fish burger was very crispy. I would definitely come back again to try another burger, the corn and fries.

MLeRc58O5j_9PadAMVLHyA.text: DF Mexico makes a really good attempt at genuine Mexican food. Very impressed. You are never going to get 50p tacos or tamales in London Town, but this place serves up some top grub at a pretty reasonable price. You order at the counter, which I like, no messing around. The chicken badboy burrito for £9 isn't a bad deal. The pork torta (burger) my mate had looked a little lightweight but tasted good i believe, decent fries. Tortilla chips looked homemade and the guac was excellent, always a good sign.A solid classic margarita, muy feurte, was decent too. Also they sell horchata. Tick.The decor is cool, communal seating, tables, and pleasant staff. Would come back.

YelvYE36kXtxAblSDO4R0Q.text: Very trendy restaurant, really good Mexican good with a modern twist. Nicely decorated and very clever ordering. Only the music was too loud and made it quite difficult to have a conversation without shouting but maybe I am just growing old ....

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom

iLX_J-aepnLhXALghfk0bw.text: At first I got this place totally wrong.I came here expecting to have  a  gourmet mexican, something like the top version of wahaca (it's from the same owner), instead this Mexican place is more a tex-mex rather than a classical old-style mexican. Hence we have less fresh vegetables and more hot heavy flavors, less coriander and more black beans!And the result is awesome!I dislike their way of serving, you have to go the counter for ordering, pay before and then you receive your food on the table. This is just slow and complex, you basically queue up in the middle of the restaurant and stay there while people next to you is eating... Just plain stupid. But then the food came, and everything was so fulfilled with flavors, nicely blent together and rich. Awesome!I went with a group so we had the opportunity to try everything, burrito, boards, tacos and everything was excellent but the fish tacos, which was a bit uninspired. My suggestion is to go for the meat, burritos boards and burgers!!Drinks are really nice, if you go for the soft drinks you'll get the possibility to try all three flavors, in particular the lemonade (made with lime, I don't remember its name) was fantastic for finishing the meal. The only missing thing, they should leave some cinnamon for the horchada, it's a kind of a rookie mistake not leaving it there next to lime and ice.Try also margarita and the ice cream, the first one, fresh frozen and with a good alcool slap, the second one made with a very good quality of vanilla, perfect finish for the meal!In conclusion, awesome place. Good, cheap, and with  interesting flavors. Just that service thing and a couple of minor issues make the rating turning down one point!

jf5IKHeHPIsiDyT_z4Y28g.text: Went with a friend, I had a chicken tosta and she had a chicken burrito. I loved it but she did not. But I love cucumber and she hates it. Warning: the burrito contains a LOT of pickled cucumber. However, it's good value, the drinks are good, and no one can hate their crinkle cut chips.

kKymY_v3naXuhakvXDgtxg.text: Loved this place, simple concept, easily executed in this establishment! My friend and I visited on a Friday evening, a short wait and we were seated. 1st love went to the juicy water, bottomless self-service affair, my favourite was the lime and chia, totally moreish and they have a help-yourself lime-ice-straw area! I was so happy! I was told the margaritas were good too!Food-wise, we went for the make your own burrito with steak and cheesy onion goodness, spicy beef nachos, which were phenomenally amazing and tender beef corn tacos which were messy but nothing cutlery doesn't solve, full of crunchy cabbage which goes well with hot meat and beans in a different way to the usual piles of lettuce at Wahaca. Someone's definitely thought it through! Big shout out to the tasty beans and crunchy chips too!Service was speedy, could have done with an extra smile, I understand its a fast food concept but seeing how good the food was, a touch better face to face interaction would be nice. Overall, I was impressed, really tasty food, better than expected on all flavour levels, only complaints? Freezing toilets and increase the size of the frozen margaritas; they come from a cool machine and the fruit purée is added, perhaps they could be stirred by staff rather than customer?Can't wait to return.

D6hGSibsNcWrLlY6mxJ1RA.text: Solid tacos.  Great sides.   Pretty good guacamole.  Go on Mondays for half price tacos!  We got lucky that we did.  We are from Southern California and have been craving some good Mexican cuisine.  This place comes pretty close.  A cpl tweaks and you'll have a real winner. 1.  Steak tacos.  Great flavor but steak is too chewy.  For a proper carne asada you're better off chopping up the steak and marinating it more and cooking it less but searing it at a high temp so it's more tender.   But still love the cheese touch and flavor is great. 2. Beef tacos.  Again great flavor.  Just a little too saucy.  Dial back the sauce a bit and make them a touch less wet and you're golden. 3. Chicken.  Great!  Chicken could be a little more tender and less dry but these were solid. Fish ones are brilliant!  Would be amazing to offer a grilled version for those gluten free / celiac folks The sides were brilliant.  Rice was awesome. Corn dish was amazing (a little too much onion but great flavor with the cheese).  Beans were also very good.  Salsas were also great.  Would love the option of some pico de gallo at the salsa bar.  All in all great.  Also the decor is perfect.  Got a good vibe and reminded me of LA and Austin.  Well done.  Will be back.

-awd0HTd50oqHhR568uA2A.text: Came here for an impromptu dinner because the menu looked good and the prices were cheap. It was pretty busy at 7 pm on a Friday night but I was still seated right away. Once you get your table, you head up to a counter and place your order and pay. If you get a drink (soda or water) there is a fountain with cups next to it, help yourself after paying to as much as you want. The server will bring your food out to you when it's ready. I got the cheese fries and Chile beef tacos (an order comes with two). The fries were seriously lacking in cheese sauce--they were okay, but I want my fries drenched in that stuff! They were nice and crispy, though. The tacos were decent. I was expecting way more of a kick, given the name "Chile beef," but to be honest they were kind of flavorless. The most flavor came from the small amount of guac on top. They weren't the worst tacos I've ever had, but they definitely could have used way more seasoning. I like the ordering system. It actually made it much more convenient to eat and leave without having to wait for a check. The staff was also really friendly. This is a pretty good place for a cheap meal, but if you're looking for something more authentically Mexican this may not satisfy.

59N07EBeMnwV4lDERL2p9w.text: Great service and amazing tacos I didn't realise the portion is huge ..So I will have to go again and try other ones

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Chilli beef tacos is well cooked

8lahYPPJXJLMvQ1vadAjDA.text: Honestly pretty decent tacos. I'm a bit surprised by the extremely negative reviews for this place. Granted, I have found Mexican food to be a bit lacking in the UK as well, but the tacos at DF/Mexico are pretty close to some of the better taco joints I remember from back home. Although I'm from Canada so maybe I don't know what I'm talking about either...Anyway, we tried the grilled steak, msc fish, and buttermilk chicken tacos. The fish tacos were my favorite, super flavourful with the right amount of crispness. Buttermilk chicken was a close second. Grilled steak was my least favorite, but still pretty tasty in my opinion. I'd be interested in trying the pork pibil in the future.Service was friendly as well. Will probably return to DF/Mexico if I'm craving tacos in London again!

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Grilled Steak, MSC Fish, Buttermilk Chicken tacos.

tSv0--dAQNLv3XGz3hTMwA.text: The staffs were friendly and the food was quite cheap, but I had no dressing on my salad and it was really dry. I could well imagine that the other foods are better, but I wouldn't recommend the salads.

q97YZnUoXBgbHrvLDk_Xkg.text: This is not good. Perhaps I am spoiled for Mexican coming from the US, but I expect more out of London with food, as London generally is fantastic for dining. I would never ever recommend coming to this restaurant, it is not only inauthentic, but generally bland and overall the food just does not taste good. Honestly you are far better off going to chipotle it is much better and no difference since you have to order at the counter here as well.

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Bland and mushy. Tried very hard to eat it but couldn't.

MVZk1HJhSXYZrwU-IrrRkA.text: If you love big, overflowing, delicious tacos then this is a place to check out. We stopped in for an afternoon snack while walking through Brick Lane Market and fortunately we only ordered one portion of the tacos (2 tacos per portion) between two of us. The tacos are huge! The battered cod taco with chipotle crema was fantastic - nice crunch to the batter and succulent white fish meat that falls apart in the mouth. We also ordered the guacamole with tortilla chips - the guac itself was great but the tortillas were a tad stale. To wash it all down we had a classic margarita and a passion fruit margarita. Frozen margaritas aren't usually my thing but these were strong and not too sweet. We didn't try any of the larger meals but would definitely stop by again for an afternoon taco fix.

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Battered cod taco with chipotle crema (the guac on the side was extra).

1REEDj9py2Gb5nt7XJ2CXg.text: Eh. That's all I got to say. The margs were great, I will give them that. The tacos were so so, the tortilla chips were on the stale side, and I have most definitely had better guacamole. BUT! The staff was very accommodating and helpful, so kudos to that. All in all, it was a fairly forgettable dining experience.

FAFJUh2koPYBnyUzVJXe7g.text: Not good Mexican if your from the states, obviously if your from the U.K. U have no idea what a good burrito should taste like......skip this, not worth your time or money, yuck!!  It was like they put coleslaw in the burrito

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Cucumbers and carrrots in a burrito???

-8rnlNH5NTOfuGxbgxfSHg.text: Worst burrito I have ever eaten. Not good Mexican food if you're from the states. Margarita machine dispensed unfrozen margaritas, avocado salsa looked and tasted like baby food, and burrito was just plain awful. Do not waste your time looking for "authentic Mexican" food. This place is NOT good.Who puts cucumbers and carrots in a burrito??? YUCK

n0NSIq8SCB3s9hcBu7wpEw.text: It's more like Mexican fast food than dine in. The interior is cool, but the food is a bit bland and it's self service. We were expecting more.

wDvOhASlpQqAnNonxKv8Ww.text: Super good Mexican food! They have Tacos, burritos, tartas and so on! It's a self order restaurant but they will bring your food to the table! I had the buttermilk tacos and they were really tasty! My friends had the chicken burrito and also loved it! It doesn't look like a lot of food but it's pretty filling! The really positive point is that it's really cheap!!

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Chicken burritos
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Buttermilk chicken tacos

gJ5S6WeeAFCAGzG3YxnUjg.text: So this is definitely more modern tex-mex than authentic mexican. With that disclaimer out of the way, I was pleasantly surprised. I had the chicken salad and the bf had some tacos. Both were very tasty. Service was friendly. Space is cool. Prices very reasonable. Not the best Mexican in London, but a solid standby nonetheless!

RvEPiZBwe67Vr-I5r8LuDA.text: This is what's up my friends - 'modern' Mexican food in London that is absolutely worth trying; This place is awesome!It's quite new and the interior is hip, fresh, fun, modern but not being too hipster (if you know what I mean). You can order at the counter, or, suuuuuper 2.0: order with the machine in front of the bar yourself - swipe your card and your order has been sent straight to the kitchen! Hassle free and fast. How's that for 2014!Staff is friendly and the food is just AWESOME! Taco's with spicy beef (and yes, it's spicy!), luscious coleslaw (yes - that can be luscious), margarita's... Or go non-alcoholic and treat yourself to some hibiscus lemonade. And, you can top it up yourself! Living on the edge my friend... Super fast service, we were in-and-out in 1 hour. So if you feel the need for a 'quickie', it's possible!Don't let me down and go here. Go team GO!!

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom
Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom

4HlTN05iTeDOqZSE-nujxQ.text: Amazing Fish tacos! They are so good, I could eat these everyday. The refillable drinks machines are fab too serving hibiscus and horchata. Prices are fab, nothing seems over priced. Will definitely have to check out the soho branch too.

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom. Fish Tacos

b3xhQ9ApYYTl6S83zCMULQ.text: It was the second time for me at DF and it would have been a five stars if they hadn't "cheekily" changed their meal deal. Last time I checked you could order your mains in a combo with sides, now sides are a la carte which adds up. Not cool.Appart from that little surprise, the food was still great, and I am a huge fan of the soft drink bar where you can juggle fresh lime and ice with mexican softs. They were out of icecream that night (boo!!) but that's a must try!!!

B67Cu0Ck51qomTEG-OLCMg.text: I expected so much from this place... What a disappointment! In my opinion it is nothing more than a fastfood restaurant that serves mediocre quality food poorly seasoned. It is to mexican food what Burger King is to cheeseburgers...

photos.caption: Photo of DF/Mexico - London, United Kingdom

GNS_s6fXdbhzmtPlWQ7Isw.text: DF's been on my 'to try' list for ages. The TLDR is while it's far from an authentic Mexican experience, it's still pretty darn good.My hunch is a group of British hipsters went to Mexico City on a stag night and came back with an intimate knowledge of how to make burritos. Except they went and decided that adding cucumbers was a solid improvement.I jest - because cucumbers in burritos are f*cking ridiculous - but I still liked the ambiance, atmosphere and yes, the burritos!

txtEObNgiPe0QkDoRz1dbw.text: Honestly one of the best Burrito's I've ever had. I'm from the States and have had many different types of burritos whether it be authentic Mexican style or Americanized versions of it but London's burrito is off the chain. It's complex with flavor and the grilled exterior makes a good char on it.

GgNbxTZL8b0bVQZG3Q7-7Q.text: I stumbled upon DF/Mexico by mistake.I was staying over in London for work, and had actually chosen another restaurant to eat at that night, in the Brick Lane area. I'm a female travelling on my own, however, and when I saw it, I felt like it wasn't somewhere where I'd be comfortable dining alone, however I remembered passing a Mexican restaurant on the way there and thought I'd try it instead. This is the place.I got seated without any issues even though the place was relatively busy. I have to say I absolutely love the ordering process - you simply choose what you want from the menu, then type it into the computer.I got the Chili con carne board, and it was absolutely delicious. I also love the bottomless soft drinks.Really impressed with this new restaurant. I later found out when I looked it up online, that it is a sister restaurant from the people who brought us Wahaca, so it was bound to be good, although DF/Mexico has a totally different feel to it.Looking forward to a return trip!
